subject: AI & Agents
title: AI Reads Ancient Scrolls Burned by Vesuvius
description: A fast breakdown of AI Reads Ancient Scrolls Burned by Vesuvius for builders.

hook.text: Papyrus scrolls carbonized by Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD. Unreadable for 2,000 years. AI decoded them.

buildup.text: The Herculaneum scrolls are so fragile they disintegrate when unrolled. Traditional reading is impossible.

discovery.text: CT scans capture the scroll structure. AI detects ink patterns on the curled layers inside.

twist.text: The Vesuvius Challenge offered prizes. A 21-year-old student won by reading the first legible passages.

climax.text: Thousands of unread scrolls may contain lost works of Greek philosophy, forever preserved in ash.

punchline.text: A volcano destroyed the library. Two millennia later, AI reads it.

quiz.question: How did AI help read the Herculaneum scrolls?
options: It detected ink patterns in CT scans of the carbonized rolls
It physically unrolled the scrolls with robotic arms
It translated ancient languages using GPT
